item.title: Japanese study books
item.description: A handbook of common Japanese phrases A handbook of common Japanese phrases, compiled by Sanseido, translated and adapted by John Brennan. OhioLink record John Brennanâ€™s translation for Japanese learners of publishing house Sanseidoâ€™s book of language etiquette originally intended for Japanese native speakers has many common set phrases (highly developed and sometimes lengthy collocations) for congratulations, condolences, making speeches, giving gifts, addressing people (eleven set phrases for â€œHave you got a moment?

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome to my blog, whose title comes from Professor Richard Hammingâ€™s motto, â€œThe purpose of computation is insight, not numbersâ€ (SIAM). After enjoying programming for years, I discovered applied math in mid-undergrad. I decided it would be harder, and therefore more interesting, than â€œjustâ€ software engineering. After years of grad school (ABD in electrical engineering from Ohio State), then working in the lovely D.C. metro area, I revised my views and came back to Ohio as a full-stack developer who just happens to know a lot about signal processing, machine learning, and scientific computing.

item.title: Co-housing
item.description: Roko Belicâ€™s 2011 documentary film Happy (Hoopla) had many memorable situations but the one I keep returning to is co-housing. Around the 39th minute, the film discusses the system in Denmark, where where several families live on a plot of land or a single building even, where specific duties, amenities, and projects are shared by all co-housers. The film explains the system through a case study of a single mother who describes the Jernstobereit co-house as the â€œmiracleâ€ she was looking for.

item.title: Announcing: Ebisu and Ebisu.js
item.description: I am very pleased to announce the release of Ebisu and Ebisu.js! These are are public-domain software libraries intended to be used by quiz or flashcard apps for intelligent, Bayesian quiz scheduling. They are released under the completely free Unlicense, and can be used anywhere by anyone without any conditions ğŸ†. The underlying algorithm is based on a principled application of Bayesian statistics, and has many nice features compared to existing scheduling algorithms ğŸ˜.
